## AI Tools Registry — Usage Guidelines

- Prefer installing official tools before writing new ones. Use the remote registry (e.g. https://ai-tools-registry.vercel.app/api/registry/public/{name}) with the shadcn CLI.
- Keep tool logic and its renderer colocated: `~/ai/tools/{tool}/tool.ts` and (optionally) `~/ai/tools/{tool}/component.tsx`.
- Mark renderers with `use client` and avoid importing them from server-only contexts.
- Validate inputs/outputs with Zod; avoid `any`.
- When contributing to a registry item, ensure each `registry:file` entry includes a `target` and that `files[*].path` exists.
- Follow naming that matches folder names (e.g., `weather`, `news`, `time`).
- Tools commonly depend on `ai` and `zod`; some renderers use `react-markdown` + `remark-gfm`.

### Install examples

```bash
npx shadcn@latest add @ai-tools/weather
npx shadcn@latest add @ai-tools/websearch
```

### Colocation pattern

```
~/ai/tools/weather/
  ├─ tool.ts        # server/tool logic
  └─ component.tsx  # optional client renderer
```

### Server/client boundaries

- Keep side-effectful code (fetch, network) inside tool `execute` on server.
- Pass plain data to the client renderer.
